column19: Francis Graffard's Gentlemanlike is interesting but COMMAND THE STARS sets a solid level to overturn
column20: 5/2 Command The Stars, 3/1 Gentlemanlike, 5/1 Victoire Magique,  Proof, 13/2 Waybreaker, 10/1 French Colorado, 14/1 Czajkowski
column32: A Jathiere, G Augustin-Normand Et Al
column36: Impressed on debut for another trainer at Chantilly in late July over 7f on soft ground
column37: Impressed on debut for another trainer at Chantilly in late July over 7f on soft ground, when beating an odds-on shot trained by Francis Graffard, so clearly interesting he is now with that handler; this trip is an unknown but the son of Australia certainly wasn't stopping last time; interesting.

column4: Prix de Conde Jockey Club de Turquie (Group 3) (2yo) (Turf)
column19: Francis Graffard's Gentlemanlike is interesting but COMMAND THE STARS sets a solid level to overturn
column20: 5/2 Command The Stars, 3/1 Gentlemanlike, 5/1 Victoire Magique,  Proof, 13/2 Waybreaker, 10/1 French Colorado, 14/1 Czajkowski
column32: Robert Bonaventure, Mme Cristel Martina & N Perret
column36: Won on second start but well held in second last time; more needed
column37: Followed debut sixth with a success at Vichy (1m, very soft) and then a second at Salon-de-Provence over 1m1f in a conditions race - well held by the winner; shouldn't have an issue with the extra furlong but a set up in needed; Christophe Soumillon on for first time.

column32: James Paul Services To Industry Ltd
column36: Has plenty of experience and sets the form standard; unproven at trip though
column37: Improved with every run, winning his second and third starts before following a second in a valuable York handicap with a mile Listed success as Craon on very soft under this rider; needs to prove he can stay this far but pedigree suggests it shouldn't be an issue; sets the standard.

column4: Prix de Conde Jockey Club de Turquie (Group 3) (2yo) (Turf)
column19: Francis Graffard's Gentlemanlike is interesting but COMMAND THE STARS sets a solid level to overturn
column20: 5/2 Command The Stars, 3/1 Gentlemanlike, 5/1 Victoire Magique,  Proof, 13/2 Waybreaker, 10/1 French Colorado, 14/1 Czajkowski
column27: Ecurie De Castillon & Scea Des Prairies
column36: This is a step in class up but showed promise over C&D on debut three weeks ago
column37: Has a nice pedigree with stamina in mind and finished second over C&D in a contest for unraced horses on debut three weeks ago as a 29-1 shot having hit the front quite early in the straight; hard to be certain what that form amounts to and this is tougher but stays the trip and is more than entitled to come on for the outing.

column4: Prix de Conde Jockey Club de Turquie (Group 3) (2yo) (Turf)
column19: Francis Graffard's Gentlemanlike is interesting but COMMAND THE STARS sets a solid level to overturn
column20: 5/2 Command The Stars, 3/1 Gentlemanlike, 5/1 Victoire Magique,  Proof, 13/2 Waybreaker, 10/1 French Colorado, 14/1 Czajkowski
column36: Won on debut but has something to prove following a modest effort after
column37: Won narrowly on debut over 7.5f at Deauville of good ground (runner-up enhanced the form since) but failed to come up to market expectations in a mile Listed race at the same track after that, finishing last of five; given a break since so a better effort might be forthcoming, but obviously has something to prove.

column4: Prix de Conde Jockey Club de Turquie (Group 3) (2yo) (Turf)
column19: Francis Graffard's Gentlemanlike is interesting but COMMAND THE STARS sets a solid level to overturn
column20: 5/2 Command The Stars, 3/1 Gentlemanlike, 5/1 Victoire Magique,  Proof, 13/2 Waybreaker, 10/1 French Colorado, 14/1 Czajkowski
column36: Looked good when beating Proof on debut and thereabouts if making progress
column37: Looked good when beating the odds-on Proof on debut 24 days ago and doesn't have to prove his stamina considering that success came over 1m2f on very soft at Lyon Parilly; open to lots of improvement and should be thereabouts if making progress.

column4: Prix de Conde Jockey Club de Turquie (Group 3) (2yo) (Turf)
column19: Francis Graffard's Gentlemanlike is interesting but COMMAND THE STARS sets a solid level to overturn
column20: 5/2 Command The Stars, 3/1 Gentlemanlike, 5/1 Victoire Magique,  Proof, 13/2 Waybreaker, 10/1 French Colorado, 14/1 Czajkowski
column36: Beaten both times, recently by Victoire Magique, but might be capable of better
column37: Has a smart pedigree but has been beaten on both of his starts, most recently by Victoire Magique over 1m2f on very soft at Lyon Parilly; had the run of the race that day, so no obvious reason why he should reverse form, but it's early days for all these, so wouldn't be a huge shock if he were to find extra from somewhere.

column37: Progressing well, including three handicap wins (1m2f, 1m6f and 2m) this season and he went agonisingly close in the 1m6f Melrose at York on latest outing; all 2025 races have been on good or firmer but he won on soft as 2yo; respected for that improvement but plenty more is needed at this level.

column36: Third type of headgear; new trip but it's hard to have much confidence in him right now

column37: Not yet truly exposed over 6f since visored, winning on two occasions (on good to firm and soft) and first home on his side for the two defeats, over C&D and in the Ayr Silver Cup; the handicapper may not have weighed him up yet and he can be a big threat.

column37: Has taken form to whole new level since joining George Bewley in the spring, winning twice (once over C&D) from four starts; lost out only narrowly in competitive race at Cartmel (2m1f, good) six weeks ago and commands respect in current mood.

column4: Carol & Malcolm Humble 20th Wedding Anniversary Handicap Hurdle

column36: Ended novice campaign with two wins in April; could easily have more to offer in handicaps
column37: Not an instant success over hurdles last season but was on the upgrade in the spring, making all in good-ground novice events at Carlisle (2m1f) and Kelso (2m); makes handicap debut after 164-day absence but could easily have more improvement to come this term.

column4: Carol & Malcolm Humble 20th Wedding Anniversary Handicap Hurdle
column19: Topweight WINDS OF WINTER has made remarkable progress for her new stable this season and is taken to record a second C&D success.

column36: Has very mixed hurdling record but won on stable debut in July; player if in right mood
column37: Has very mixed hurdling record for three different stables but came good for this one at first attempt, at Bangor (2m3f, good) in July, and rebounded from poor run with pretty good fourth at Sedgefield (2m4f, good) last month; has a fighting chance here if on another going day.

column4: Carol & Malcolm Humble 20th Wedding Anniversary Handicap Hurdle

column37: Won four-runner chase here (1m7f, good) in first-time blinkers in June but has regressed and become inconsistent under all codes; tailed off on the Flat in refitted cheekpieces a fortnight ago and not an easy one to predict on this return to hurdling; blinkers back on.

column4: Carol & Malcolm Humble 20th Wedding Anniversary Handicap Hurdle

column37: Signed off in Ireland with close third in Cork handicap (2m4f, good) in May and probably didn't need to improve to record ready success in Stratford maiden (2m, good to firm) on stable debut in July; no surprise if he builds on that winning performance here.

column37: 2-6 for new stable since the spring; looked in particularly good nick when sauntering clear on run-in at Perth (2m, good) nine days ago and needs to be taken very seriously under 7lb penalty here (due to go up 8lb).

column37: Heavy-ground hurdle winner in Ireland in spring 2024; well beaten over fences on stable debut in June and two very underwhelming hurdle runs have followed; of interest only if much stronger in the betting this time.

column37: Can sometimes be a difficult to reel in when he blasts off in front, and was a massive-margin winner at Market Rasen (2m4f, good) in July; also suited by this track but he's not easy to predict nowadays.

column37: Very unexposed 6yo who made quite encouraging stable debut in June, keeping on steadily for fourth in 2m Uttoxeter novice; hiked up in trip for this handicap debut and open to significant improvement.

column37: Disappointed when dropped back to 2m4f here in June and is now 0-9 over hurdles but went close on consecutive outings at Kelso (3m/3m2f, good) in May and has been given a wind op since that last run; could have a say.

column37: Thorough stayer who posted career-best performance when making all to score by 5l at Cartmel (3m1f, good) six weeks ago; subsequent 7lb rise demands even more from her, though

column37: Largely consistent 8yo who will be suited by today's trip-and-ground combination; fell on latest appearance in June, though, and resumes with hurdling strike-rate standing at 0-23.

column37: Dual C&D winner; chased home rejuvenated rival here on latest outing in June and has possibilities if in similar form again after his break but would appeal more on ground slower than good.

column37: Placed over hurdles at Huntingdon (3m1f, good to soft) in February and won a heavy-ground chase later that month but she returned from a break with low-key run three weeks ago and could use some rain here; cheekpieces refitted.

column36: Only fourth when very strongly backed last month but certainly didn't run badly

column37: Dual chase winner in 2024; returned from one-year absence with low-key hurdle run for new stable in July but shaped with a lot more promise at Perth last month and should now be at concert pitch for this return to fences.

column37: Won over fences and hurdles for the Greenall-Guerriero stable in March and still has low mileage but was just a respectable fourth at Sedgefield (2m3f, good) last month, after a break, and needs to kick on again on this stable debut.

column4: Congratulations Luke England & Jessica Lee Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)

column37: Unplaced all five hurdling starts, most recently when well-held sixth at Wetherby (3m, good; first-time cheekpieces) in March; may improve now switched to fences but others in this line-up have much less to prove.

column36: Rallied gamely for narrow C&D win in August; now 2-6 over fences; likely contender again
column37: Rallied gamely to regain lead close home over C&D (good) in August and is now 2-6 over fences (other win also over C&D); recent 3lb rise ought to be manageable; likely contender again.

column36: Placed in all five chases (twice over C&D) and has very obvious claims again
column37: Placed in all five chases, the first two over C&D in May (good to soft/good); bumped into an improver when clear second at Perth (3m, good) in August and will be a tough nut to crack here if last month's wind op makes any positive difference.

column4: Congratulations Luke England & Jessica Lee Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)

column36: Bounced back quickly from poor stable debut with good second at Sedgefield last month
column37: Won over hurdles for Dan Skelton this summer and bounced back quickly from very disappointing stable debut with good second over fences at Sedgefield (2m5f, good) last month; no surprise if he's on the premises here.

column4: Congratulations Luke England & Jessica Lee Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)

column36: Course winner for Pauline Robson but very inconsistent for her; now with new stable
column37: Won here (1m7f, heavy) on chase/handicap debut for Pauline Robson in December 2023 but ran to form on only one of five starts last season; changed hands for £4,000 in May and makes stable debut after 172-day break; market may guide.

column4: Congratulations Luke England & Jessica Lee Handicap Chase (Go North Monet's Garden Series Qualifier)

column36: Has modest strike-rate but was placed here off today's mark three times in the spring
column37: Has modest 1-20 strike-rate over fences and did not fire on latest outing in July (had wind op soon afterwards) but was placed three consecutive times off today's mark here (1m7f-2m4f, good to soft) in the spring; not out of this if aided by refitted cheekpieces.

column36: Very useful form at Pattern level in Britain and France, sets a decent standard here

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Star Appeal Stakes (Listed Race)

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Star Appeal Stakes (Listed Race)

column37: By Wootton Bassett out of an unraced sister to Yorkshire Oaks winner Tapestry; should be ready for this quick jump in class after winning readily from a once-raced stablemate on debut at Listowel; coped with heavy ground then, but no strong reason why he should fail to act effectively on this surface.

column37: Rated 81 on the Flat with a Leopardstown maiden to his name from 2021; not too bad on hurdles debut at Leopardstown when finishing in mid-division; distant third of 11 at Listowel last time following a Flat summer campaign that bore little success, though kept good company.

column37: Heavy ground maiden hurdle winner at Punchestown in February before some decent efforts in competitive contests; struck again with a supremely comfortable victory at Bellewstown in August (2m1f, good); tongue-tie now added to the previously worn hood after she weakened quickly at Listowel last time; avoids penalty and leading contender if back to her best.

column37: Two-time chase winner in 2021 is winless from 14 over hurdles; out of form over fences this year and fell when last seen in a Punchestown festival handicap chase; others preferred.

column37: Left form for previous yard behind when landing a touch on debut for this yard at Leopardstown (2m, yielding) in March; hiked up 17lb and came up short off his revised mark at Tipperary (2m, gd-yld); must improve for this longer trip.

column36: Won off 4lb lower in May, soundly beaten since, cheekpieces and tongue tie tried
column37: Won off 4lb lower at Limerick (2m3f, good) in May; soundly beaten in two hurdles since and beat just one rival home on soft on the Flat on latest at Clonmel; tongue tie and cheekpieces now tried.

column4: Thomastown Handicap Hurdle
column19: Given how well his Killarney win has worked out, ROCKONLIAM could be thrown in off an opening mark of 103
column20: 5/2 Rockonliam, 100/30 Paul's Dream, 5/1 Live To Laugh, 7/1 Killian's Garden, 10/1 Darcy's Friend, 11/1 Truckers Cruising, 12/1 Ilbdare,  Minority Interest, 20/1 Matter Of Opinion, 25/1 You Done Well, 28/1 Dream Shaper, 40/1 Spread The Faith
column36: Won over 3m2f (good) on penultimate, excuse latest, down in trip, forecast rain a concern
column37: Off the mark over 3m2f at Sligo (good) on penultimate off 9lb lower; scoped dirty after 27l defeat over the same C&D off revised mark; big drop in trip here and the forecast rain looks a negative for him.

column4: Thomastown Handicap Hurdle
column19: Given how well his Killarney win has worked out, ROCKONLIAM could be thrown in off an opening mark of 103

column32: Ed Mulligan & John Finnegan & Aileen Saunders & Ann Holton
column36: Point winner, modest form under rules inc' on stable debut latest, hood needs to transform
column37: Point-to-point winner has yet to make much of an impact under Rules; beaten 12l in a weaker race than this at Navan (2m3f, yielding) on stable debut latest; needs to improve for addition of a hood.

column4: Thomastown Handicap Hurdle
column19: Given how well his Killarney win has worked out, ROCKONLIAM could be thrown in off an opening mark of 103
column20: 5/2 Rockonliam, 100/30 Paul's Dream, 5/1 Live To Laugh, 7/1 Killian's Garden, 10/1 Darcy's Friend, 11/1 Truckers Cruising, 12/1 Ilbdare,  Minority Interest, 20/1 Matter Of Opinion, 25/1 You Done Well, 28/1 Dream Shaper, 40/1 Spread The Faith
column32: J Whittle/M McEvoy/Good For A Laugh Synd'/A Callan
column36: Improved efforts last twice off this mark, should go well again, soft would be a query
column37: Has improved last two starts in handicaps, a 4.5l fourth at Down Royal (3m, gd-fm) followed by a 4.75l second at Roscommon (2m4f, good); same mark now and should go well again, though soft would be an unknown.

column4: Thomastown Handicap Hurdle
column19: Given how well his Killarney win has worked out, ROCKONLIAM could be thrown in off an opening mark of 103
column20: 5/2 Rockonliam, 100/30 Paul's Dream, 5/1 Live To Laugh, 7/1 Killian's Garden, 10/1 Darcy's Friend, 11/1 Truckers Cruising, 12/1 Ilbdare,  Minority Interest, 20/1 Matter Of Opinion, 25/1 You Done Well, 28/1 Dream Shaper, 40/1 Spread The Faith
column36: Extended record over timber to 0-12 on latest, yet to finish in first three, hard to fancy
column37: Longstanding maiden extended record over hurdles to 0-12 at Galway last month; yet to finish in the first three; not easy to make a case for.

column4: Thomastown Handicap Hurdle
column19: Given how well his Killarney win has worked out, ROCKONLIAM could be thrown in off an opening mark of 103
column20: 5/2 Rockonliam, 100/30 Paul's Dream, 5/1 Live To Laugh, 7/1 Killian's Garden, 10/1 Darcy's Friend, 11/1 Truckers Cruising, 12/1 Ilbdare,  Minority Interest, 20/1 Matter Of Opinion, 25/1 You Done Well, 28/1 Dream Shaper, 40/1 Spread The Faith
column36: Best runs have come at Kilbeggan, ran poorly sole start on soft, needs to find more
column37: Best two efforts have come at Kilbeggan over 2m3f on good ground, including a 6.25l fourth on latest; ran poorly sole start on soft, though that may have been needed after a break; needs more.

column4: Thomastown Handicap Hurdle
column19: Given how well his Killarney win has worked out, ROCKONLIAM could be thrown in off an opening mark of 103

column36: Ordinary form in maidens and first two h'caps, lacks a recent run, may need more time
column37: Ordinary form in maidens and no signs of progress in first two starts in handicaps; lacks a recent run and may need more time.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mucklemeg Mares Flat Race (Listed Race)
column19: Willie Mullins' LIADAWN won decisively on soft ground on debut and is preferred by Patrick Mullins so she looks the safest bet
column20: 5/2 Liadawn, 3/1 Some Pretender, 7/2 Closutton, 5/1 Maximillian Lady, 17/2 Brosna Queen, 9/1 Something Fabulous, 28/1 Muted Melody, 33/1 Courtmac Gesture
column36: Off the mark at second attempt at Punchestown, well bred, soft would be a query
column37: Built on promising debut run at Punchestown (2m, yielding) when winning a mares' bumper at the same venue second time up; nicely bred and well worth a go at this level, though very soft ground would be an unknown.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mucklemeg Mares Flat Race (Listed Race)
column19: Willie Mullins' LIADAWN won decisively on soft ground on debut and is preferred by Patrick Mullins so she looks the safest bet
column20: 5/2 Liadawn, 3/1 Some Pretender, 7/2 Closutton, 5/1 Maximillian Lady, 17/2 Brosna Queen, 9/1 Something Fabulous, 28/1 Muted Melody, 33/1 Courtmac Gesture
column36: Won on debut at Downpatrick, runner up has won since, deserted by Patrick Mullins
column37: One of three for yard; justified favouritism on debut in a Downpatrick bumper (2m3f, good); the 0.5l runner up (previously 10l behind Liadawn) has won since but this shorter trip and possible soft ground are unknowns and Patrick Mullins has jumped ship.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mucklemeg Mares Flat Race (Listed Race)
column19: Willie Mullins' LIADAWN won decisively on soft ground on debut and is preferred by Patrick Mullins so she looks the safest bet
column20: 5/2 Liadawn, 3/1 Some Pretender, 7/2 Closutton, 5/1 Maximillian Lady, 17/2 Brosna Queen, 9/1 Something Fabulous, 28/1 Muted Melody, 33/1 Courtmac Gesture
column36: The choice of Patrick Mullins, hacked up on easy ground on debut, leading claims
column37: One of three for yard and the choice of Patrick Mullins; had subsequent winners behind when hacking up by 10l on debut at Downpatrick (2m2f, yld-sft) in June; one of the few in here with form on soft ground and she has leading claims.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mucklemeg Mares Flat Race (Listed Race)
column19: Willie Mullins' LIADAWN won decisively on soft ground on debut and is preferred by Patrick Mullins so she looks the safest bet
column20: 5/2 Liadawn, 3/1 Some Pretender, 7/2 Closutton, 5/1 Maximillian Lady, 17/2 Brosna Queen, 9/1 Something Fabulous, 28/1 Muted Melody, 33/1 Courtmac Gesture
column36: Won on debut at Galway, form has been boosted, should handle soft on breeding, chance
column37: One of three for yard; justified short odds when scoring by 0.75l on debut at the Galway Festival (2m1f, good) and the fourth and seventh have won since; Patrick Mullins prefers Liadawn but there's a fair chance she'll handle soft on breeding so she shouldn't be underestimated.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mucklemeg Mares Flat Race (Listed Race)
column19: Willie Mullins' LIADAWN won decisively on soft ground on debut and is preferred by Patrick Mullins so she looks the safest bet
column20: 5/2 Liadawn, 3/1 Some Pretender, 7/2 Closutton, 5/1 Maximillian Lady, 17/2 Brosna Queen, 9/1 Something Fabulous, 28/1 Muted Melody, 33/1 Courtmac Gesture
column36: Behind Some Pretender at Galway, won at Tramore, may need to improve again, soft a query
column37: Well behind Some Pretender on Rules' debut at Galway but left that form behind to score narrowly at Tramore (16.5f, good); will probably need to improve again to feature here; unraced on softer than good.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mucklemeg Mares Flat Race (Listed Race)
column19: Willie Mullins' LIADAWN won decisively on soft ground on debut and is preferred by Patrick Mullins so she looks the safest bet
column20: 5/2 Liadawn, 3/1 Some Pretender, 7/2 Closutton, 5/1 Maximillian Lady, 17/2 Brosna Queen, 9/1 Something Fabulous, 28/1 Muted Melody, 33/1 Courtmac Gesture
column36: Placed in two of three starts, beaten 13l when second latest, needs more, soft an unknown
column37: Placed in two of three bumper starts, beaten 20l when third at Clonmel on debut (2m, good) and 13l when second behind Maximillian Lady at Galway (16.5f, gd-yld); much more required here and mixed messages in pedigree regarding soft ground.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mucklemeg Mares Flat Race (Listed Race)
column19: Willie Mullins' LIADAWN won decisively on soft ground on debut and is preferred by Patrick Mullins so she looks the safest bet
column20: 5/2 Liadawn, 3/1 Some Pretender, 7/2 Closutton, 5/1 Maximillian Lady, 17/2 Brosna Queen, 9/1 Something Fabulous, 28/1 Muted Melody, 33/1 Courtmac Gesture
column36: Wide margin win on second Rules' start at Galway, has talent but soft ground an unknown
column37: Good second on Rules' debut at Ballinrobe (16.5f, good); wide margin win at Galway (16.5f, gd-yld) second time up under a patient ride; clearly has a decent level of ability but, as is the case with a few of these, rain softened ground would be an unknown.

column4: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mucklemeg Mares Flat Race (Listed Race)
column19: Willie Mullins' LIADAWN won decisively on soft ground on debut and is preferred by Patrick Mullins so she looks the safest bet
column20: 5/2 Liadawn, 3/1 Some Pretender, 7/2 Closutton, 5/1 Maximillian Lady, 17/2 Brosna Queen, 9/1 Something Fabulous, 28/1 Muted Melody, 33/1 Courtmac Gesture
column36: Promise last two starts, well beaten sole try on easy ground, more needed in this grade
column37: Creditable efforts the last twice at Wexford (2m, good) and Kilbeggan (19.5f, gd-yld); could only manage a 13l ninth on sole start on easy ground at Killarney; needs much more in this higher grade.
